artist.name: Tim Van Hook
artist.bio:
I had a major stroke when I was 62 in 2014. With therapy, I learned to
walk and talk again, but remain unable to use my right (dominant) hand and
arm. Before the stroke I had written poems and stories, and in 2015-6 I
tried writing again, some of which is in the Writing folder. I had another
stroke in 2017 and we moved cross country to live with our son Sam. In the
past I had built furniture and sculpture, and, although I hadnâ€™t used the tools
since my major stroke, I had them moved as well. Sam set up a workshop
in our shared house, and, with his help, I decided to see what I could make
one handed.

pieces.name: Sunrise Over the Mountains
pieces.description: A vivid depiction of a sunrise over a mountain range, capturing the first light of dawn.

pieces.name: Whispers of the Wind
pieces.body:
Gentle breeze, unseen force
Shaping the world, course by course
Whispers of change, soft and low
Nature's breath, forever to flow

pieces.name: Urban Jungle
pieces.description: A black and white photograph capturing the contrast between nature and urban architecture.
